title: Brad Fritsch
text:
Brad Fritsch (born November 9, 1977) is a Canadian <a href="professional%20golfer">professional golfer</a>.
Fritsch was born in <a href="Edmonton">Edmonton</a>, <a href="Alberta">Alberta</a> and grew up in <a href="Ottawa">Ottawa</a>, <a href="Ontario">Ontario</a>.
Fritsch played on the <a href="Canadian%20Tour">Canadian Tour</a> from 2001 to 2006 and again from 2010 to 2011. His best finish was second at the 2004 <a href="Bay%20Mills%20Open%20Players%20Championship">Bay Mills Open Players Championship</a>. He played on the <a href="Web.com%20Tour">Web.com Tour</a> from 2007 to 2009, 2012 and 2015. He won the Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament in 2014. His best finish was T-2 at the 2012 <a href="Mylan%20Classic">Mylan Classic</a>.
Fritsch gained his <a href="PGA%20Tour">PGA Tour</a> card for 2013 by finishing in the top 25 of the Web.com Tour money list in 2012. He improved his position by finishing T-7 at the <a href="2012%20PGA%20Tour%20Qualifying%20School%20graduates">2012 PGA Tour Qualifying School</a>. He made 18 cuts in 24 events in 2013, finishing 142nd on the money list and missing the <a href="FedEx%20Cup">FedEx Cup</a> playoffs by four places (ranked 129th). He played in the <a href="Web.com%20Tour%20Finals">Web.com Tour Finals</a> and finished 14th to regain his PGA Tour card for 2014. He won his first Web.com Tour tournament, the <a href="Servientrega%20Championship">Servientrega Championship</a>, in 2016.
In <a href="2013%20World%20Cup%20of%20Golf">2013</a>, Fritsch represented Canada in the <a href="World%20Cup%20%28men%27s%20golf%29">World Cup</a> together with <a href="David%20Hearn%20%28golfer%29">David Hearn</a> and the two-man team finished 5th.
Fritsch was suspended by the PGA Tour for three months in 2018 for violation of its anti-doping policy after he self-reported taking a banned substance. Taking to Facebook, Fritsch said he was 'embarrassed' at not paying attention to the supplements that was in the spray which he was taking as part of a weight loss program.
Professional wins (2).
Web.com Tour wins (1).
Web.com Tour playoff record (1–0)
Team appearances.
Professional
